SENT.plain: Azacitidine is a pyrimidine nucleoside analog licensed for treatment of adult patients with myelodysplastic syndrome
Azacitidine acts as an inducer of cell differentiation by causing demethylation and re-expression of genes silenced by hypermethylation
We report a 56-year-old man with myelodysplastic syndrome who developed interstitial lung disease after azacitidine therapy
Open lung biopsy revealed a nonresolving organizing pneumonia pattern and bronchocentric granulomatous pattern suggestive of drug-induced lung injury
Treatment with steroids and discontinuation of azacitidine led to resolution of interstitial lung disease
The Naranjo adverse drug reaction probability scale score indicated that the association between azacitidine and interstitial lung disease was probable
Interstitial lung disease is a serious but uncommon side effect of this relatively safe drug
The mechanism underlying this is still unclear
The patient was subsequently treated with decitabine with no recurrence of interstitial lung disease
